entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is the main character in the conversation, mentioned by name and referred to as 'him'. (e.g. 'said Harry', 'looking around')

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is a person of authority, mentioned by name and described with a title ('beamed at him'). (e.g. 'Dumbledore beamed at him')

entities.name: mouth-organ
entities.description: The mouth-organ is an object mentioned in the conversation, described as a specific item ('the mouth-organ'). (e.g. 'I thought you might have the mouth-organ')

entities.name: ring
entities.description: The ring is an object mentioned in the conversation, described as something that has gone missing ('the ring's gone'). (e.g. 'The ring’s gone')

relationships.description: Harry is looking for the mouth-organ, implying that he has it or is supposed to have it. (e.g. 'I thought you might have the mouth-organ')
Dumbledore implies that he has the mouth-organ, but also says it's just a 'mouth-organ'. (e.g. 'the mouth-organ was only ever a mouth-organ')
Harry mentions that the ring is gone, implying that he has lost it or is responsible for its disappearance. (e.g. 'The ring’s gone')
